gr.fire.browser.util
Class HttpClient

java.lang.Object
  gr.fire.browser.util.HttpClient

public class HttpClient
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements the Http functionality for the Browser module. It makes http requests using the supplied FireConnector instance and handles cookies and redirects approprietly. It also supports local file urls (starting with file://) The HttpClient instance can remember the previous request made and can handle appropriatelly relative URLs based on that information.

Author:
padeler
See Also:
FireConnector, Browser

Method Detail

getAbsolutEncodedURL

public java.lang.String getAbsolutEncodedURL(java.lang.String url)
This method performs a URL encode on the parameters in the URL and if it is relative it converts it to absolute.

Parameters:
url -
Returns:
The absolute url-encoded URL

requestResource

public Response requestResource(java.lang.String url,
                                java.lang.String requestMethod,
                                java.util.Hashtable requestProperties,
                                byte[] data,
                                boolean updateCurrentPage)
                         throws java.io.InterruptedIOException,
                                java.lang.SecurityException,
                                java.io.IOException,
                                java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                java.lang.Exception
Makes a http request to URL using the set method (HttpConnection.GET or HttpConnection.POST) and the supplied request parameters.

Parameters:
url -
requestMethod -
requestProperties - User supplied Http request header parameters.
data - if method is POST then the post data are in this array.
updateCurrentPage - if set to true the HttpClient will remember the URL of this request in order to handle feature relative path requests
Returns:
Throws:
java.io.InterruptedIOException
java.lang.SecurityException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.Exception
